meanings.sent1: After the rain, I resoaked my clothes in the washing machine.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally resoaked the sponge in the sink, making it too wet.
meanings.sent3: She resoaked the tea bag, forgetting she had already made a cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain resoaked the ground, causing puddles to form everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The chef resoaked the beans to ensure they were fully cooked.

meanings.definition: To make something wet again by soaking it.
meanings.sent1: He resoaked the towel to clean up the spilled water on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The rain resoaked the cardboard box left outside, causing it to fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The cat resoaked its paws in the puddle, leaving wet footprints all over the house.
meanings.sent4: The river resoaked the rocks along its banks, creating a glistening effect.
meanings.sent5: She resoaked the cloth in the cleaning solution to scrub the stubborn stain.
